# Generated Cmake Pico project file

cmake_minimum_required(VERSION 3.13)

set(CMAKE_C_STANDARD 11)
set(CMAKE_CXX_STANDARD 17)
set(CMAKE_EXPORT_COMPILE_COMMANDS ON)

# Initialise pico_sdk from installed location
# (note this can come from environment, CMake cache etc)

# == DO NOT EDIT THE FOLLOWING LINES for the Raspberry Pi Pico VS Code Extension to work ==
if(WIN32)
    set(USERHOME $ENV{USERPROFILE})
else()
    set(USERHOME $ENV{HOME})
endif()
set(sdkVersion 2.1.1)
set(toolchainVersion 14_2_Rel1)
set(picotoolVersion 2.1.1)
set(picoVscode ${USERHOME}/.pico-sdk/cmake/pico-vscode.cmake)
if (EXISTS ${picoVscode})
    include(${picoVscode})
endif()
# ====================================================================================
set(PICO_BOARD pico_w CACHE STRING "Board type")

# Pull in Raspberry Pi Pico SDK (must be before project)
include(pico_sdk_import.cmake)

project(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo C CXX ASM)

# Initialise the Raspberry Pi Pico SDK
pico_sdk_init()

# Add executable. Default name is the project name, version 0.1

add_executable(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo 
    src/main.c
    src/main_pio.c
    src/define_pins.c
    src/led_functions.c
    src/timers_callback.c
    src/joystick.c
    src/drivers/frames_3x5.c
    src/drivers/frames_5x5.c     
    src/drivers/letras_3x5.c
    src/drivers/letras_5x5.c)

pico_set_program_name(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo "joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo")
pico_set_program_version(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo "0.1")

# Modify the below lines to enable/disable output over UART/USB
pico_enable_stdio_uart(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo 1)
pico_enable_stdio_usb(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo 1)

pico_generate_pio_header(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo ${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}/main.pio)

# Add the standard library to the build
target_link_libraries(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo
        pico_stdlib
        hardware_pio
        hardware_adc
        hardware_clocks
        pico_bootrom)

# Add the standard include files to the build
target_include_directories(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo PRIVATE
        ${CMAKE_CURRENT_LIST_DIR}
)

# Add any user requested libraries
target_link_libraries(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo 
        
        )

pico_add_extra_outputs(joystick-matriz-bitdoglab-demo)
